item.title: ‘El Chapo’ Extradition Sought by U.S. Before Escape
item.description: The request, made weeks before Joaquín Guzmán Loera broke out of prison, raises questions about the relationship between the United States and Mexico.
item.dc:creator: AZAM AHMED

item.title: Egyptian Forces Kill 6 Protesters During Clashes
item.description: The deaths highlighted the continued tensions in Islamist strongholds two years after the military takeover that removed President Mohamed Morsi.
item.dc:creator: DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

item.title: Saudi-Backed Forces Said to Wrest Aden, Yemen, From Houthis
item.description: The exiled prime minister, writing on Facebook, called it a “historic moment” and said his government would turn its attention to repairing the devastation.
item.dc:creator: KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: Suicide Bombs Kill 64 in Northeast Nigeria on Muslim Holiday
item.description: Suicide bombs have killed at least 64 people in multiple blasts in the northeastern towns of Gombe and Damaturu, officials said Friday, scaring people into staying home during the Muslim Eid al-Fitr celebration.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Video Purports to Show Ukraine Rebels After Downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17
item.description: A year after Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 went down in eastern Ukraine, video from an Australian news outlet seems to show pro-Russian separatists amid the wreckage.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Locals on a religious procession at the crash site of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17, near the village of Hrabove, Ukraine, on Friday, marking one year since the plane was shot down.

item.title: German Parliament Approves Deal for Greek Bailout Talks
item.description: Chancellor Angela Merkel and her finance minister had urged legislators to back the bailout, which both called “a last attempt” to order Greece’s finances and build a functioning state.
item.dc:creator: ALISON SMALE
item.media:description: Chancellor Angela Merkel and her finance minister, Wolfgang Schäuble, on Friday. Both urged the German Parliament to back the Greek bailout.

item.title: Japan Scraps Olympic Stadium Plan Over $2 Billion Price Tag
item.description: Tokyo will start over in designing the centerpiece of the 2020 Games, which, if built, would probably have been the costliest sports venue in history.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN SOBLE
item.media:credit: Japan Sport Council, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: The 80,000-seat venue would have been bigger than the main stadiums for the last two Summer Games, in London and Beijing. A costly retractable roof was seen by many as an extravagance.

item.title: British Pilots Have Been Conducting Airstrikes in Syria, Defense Ministry Confirms
item.description: Pilots joined with the American-led coalition to fight the Islamic State, it said, even though Parliament had voted against military action there.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: European Agency Proposes Tougher Medical and Psychological Oversight of Pilots
item.description: Among the recommendations by the European Aviation Safety Agency are random drug and alcohol testing of flight crews.
item.dc:creator: NICOLA CLARK

item.title: The Outlaw Ocean: Stowaways and Crimes Aboard a Scofflaw Ship
item.description: Few places on earth are as free from legal oversight as the high seas. One ship has been among the most persistent offenders.
item.dc:creator: IAN URBINA
item.media:credit: Basil Childers for The New York Times

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Chinese Qigong Master Said to Be Detained in Murder Case
item.description: Wang Lin, a famous spiritual guru, was detained along with three other men in connection with the kidnapping and death a businessman, according to news reports.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: Samsung C&T Shareholders Back Merger Over Hedge Fund’s Objections
item.description: The vote in favor of a merger with another Samsung company, Cheil Industries, was a rebuke to Elliott Associates and is seen as clearing a succession path.
item.dc:creator: CHOE SANG-HUN and NEIL GOUGH
item.media:description: Choi Chi-hun, president and chief executive at Samsung C&T, being surrounded by reporters at a general meeting of stockholders in Seoul, South Korea, on Friday.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: The Most-Viewed Fitting Room in China
item.description: China’s online censors are supposed to block pornography, yet a sex video shot in a Uniqlo clothing store in Beijing was almost impossible to avoid seeing this week.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Because of a viral sex video, the Uniqlo in Sanlitun Village, a Beijing shopping mall, is now China’s most famous.

item.title: News Analysis: Netanyahu May Turn Iran Defeat to His Favor
item.description: Even critics say that while the prime minister’s international standing has suffered, he is likely to survive relatively unscathed at home.
item.dc:creator: JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: The British foreign secretary, Philip Hammond, left, and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel delivered joint statements on Iran in Jerusalem on Thursday.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Google Maps Changes Name on Disputed South China Sea Shoal
item.description: Complaints were raised after the Internet giant dropped Scarborough Shoal, a longstanding name taken from a ship that smashed against it in 1784, and described the island as part of China’s Zhongsha chain.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: A Filipino businessman, Mel Velarde, pointing to a replica of a 1734 map he bought at auction in London that shows Scarborough Shoal as part of Philippine territory under Spanish rule. The Philippine government requested copies of historical maps for its arbitration case against China in The Hague.

item.title: Former U.S. Diplomats Praise Iran Deal
item.description: More than 100 former American ambassadors wrote to President Obama, calling the deal a “landmark agreement” and urging Congress to support it.
item.dc:creator: JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

item.title: New Review Ordered Into Israel’s Gaza Flotilla Raid
item.description: Judges of the International Criminal Court told the court’s chief prosecutor to review her decision not to investigate the deadly 2010 encounter.
item.dc:creator: MARLISE SIMONS and RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Nuclear Pact Raises Kin’s Hopes of Freedom for 3 Held in Iran
item.description: Relatives of three imprisoned Americans expressed optimism on Wednesday that the agreement had removed a significant political obstacle to efforts to secure their release.
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE
item.media:description: Naghmeh Abedini, left, the wife of a prisoner, and Sarah Hekmati, the sister of another, at a congressional hearing in June.

item.title: $1 Million Price Tag Hinted at in El Chapo’s Escape
item.description: At least one expert is certain that the breakout of the drug kingpin required a professional engineer.
item.dc:creator: AZAM AHMED and PAULINA VILLEGAS
item.media:description: The hole in the shower floor in Altiplano prison through which Joaquín Guzmán Loera made his way into an escape tunnel.

item.title: World Briefing: Kyrgyzstan: 4 Militants Die in Shootout in the Capital
item.description: Four militants linked to a terrorist organization have been killed in a shootout in the country’s capital, Bishkek, officials said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
